2.rationale:
I'll explain my reasoning:

Our snake (ID 2) just consumed an apple arriving at (8,7), so its body now consists of the head at (8,7) and the retained tail segment at (7,7). We can’t immediately go LEFT into (7,7) (that would be an illegal “reverse” collision with our own neck). Since our other options from (8,7) are UP, RIGHT, and DOWN, I looked at which move would set us up to access an apple on a subsequent turn.

The closest apples are at (5,7) and along row4 ((7,4), (6,4), (5,4)); even though (5,7) is on the same row, we can’t go directly left due to our body. 

If we move DOWN to (8,6), we'll free up our tail cell because in a non-apple move the tail is removed. That will allow us to steer towards an apple—for example, we can then move LEFT toward (7,6) and eventually down to (7,4) (an apple cell) in the following turns. Meanwhile, UP or RIGHT wouldn’t bring us any closer to an available apple.

Therefore, my strategic decision for the next move is to head DOWN.

Next move: DOWN.

2.rationale:
Let’s break down our current situation:

• Our snake (ID 2) is currently at (8,6), and our only body segment is at (8,7). (Remember, going into (8,7) immediately is illegal because that’s our own neck.)  
• Apples are clustered on row 4 at (5,4), (6,4), and (7,4), and there’s another apple at (5,7). The cluster on row 4 appears especially appealing.  
• The enemy snake (Snake #1) is well away at (8,2), so there’s little concern from that front.

From our head at (8,6) our legal moves are:  
– RIGHT to (9,6), which moves us away from the apple zone,  
– DOWN to (8,5), or  
– LEFT to (7,6).

Both LEFT and DOWN bring us closer to the cluster on row 4. However, moving LEFT places us directly in line with the apple at (7,4). For instance, if we choose LEFT the sequence could be:  
(8,6) → (7,6) → (7,5) → (7,4) where we can collect an apple.  

Going DOWN (to (8,5)) would also bring us closer but would require an extra lateral move toward the apple cluster. Also, staying too far to the right may eventually force us to traverse a longer path.  

Thus, the most direct route towards the appealing apple cluster is to move LEFT.

Next move: LEFT.
